definition: to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]

sentences.english: Bad diction marred the effectiveness of her speech.
sentences.chinese: 文辞不当削弱了他演讲的渲染力。

sentences.english: You who're so good with words and at keeping things vague.
sentences.chinese: 你向来善于文辞与暧昧不明。

sentences.english: Concise words was a characteristic statement in ancient Chinese philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 文辞简约成为古代中国哲学的表述特色。

sentences.english: French-style floridity survives, just, only in the context of diplomatic correspondence.
sentences.chinese: 客观地讲，法式华丽文辞只存在于外交信函中。

sentences.english: Opera music and diction between the high degree of relevance.
sentences.chinese: 戏曲的音乐与文辞之间具有高度的相关性。

definition: literary talent/literary grace/rich and bright colors
old language/the Classics/Classical Chinese as a literary model, esp. in Tang and Song prose/Classical Chinese as a school subject
doctrine (esp. religious)/argumentation (in a speech or essay)
vigor of strokes in calligraphy or drawing/vigor of style in literary composition
to interpret and make glossaries and commentaries on classic texts
